newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swissair to ban smoking on transatlantic flights.
newsitem.headline: Swissair to ban smoking on transatlantic flights.

text.p: Swissair will ban smoking on its transatlantic routes from March 30 because of complaints from a growing number of non-smoker clients, a company spokesman said.

Jean-Claude Donzel told the Swiss news agency ATS at the weekend that the decision was also in line with a smoking ban to be imposed on transatlantic routes by Swissair's three partners -- Delta Air Lines, Austrian Airlines and loss-making Sabena.
The United States already bans smoking on all domestic flights.
A recent industry survey found that two-thirds of business passengers favoured a total smoking ban on all international routes and another 11 percent wanted it banned on most flights.

The Europeans are the most "pro-smoking" among the world's business travellers, with nearly 25 percent opposing any further curbs, according to the survey of 1,000 business passengers, conducted by the International Air Transport Association.
